title: Maxre
author: Maxre
content: Hi guys I created this task because I was wondering that wether someone got some more than 10k or even 50k dogecoin in 2018 or even 2017 where dogecoin price was very low and at that time I was getting free money from https://freedogeco.in (Note: This website has been shut down) And I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future.

comments.author: LTU_btc
comments.body: Thanks for reminding about Freedoge.co.in. I had account there and I earned significant amount of Dogecoin. Had screenshot with full my stats there, but now I can't find it. But I think it was about 100k in total and maybe more. But I sold most of long time ago when value of it was joke. Maybe I got few hundreds $ in total. Never tried to hold it and keep big amounts of DOGE. Now I found my old address and there is still over 8000 DOGE remaining, or $600. Now I only have to find way how to access this wallet, somehwere I had details of it.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMAnd I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future. I have a similar experience, so I can understand your regret. That being said, we don't know the future so it's a matter of luck IMO. Who will believe you if you tell that Bitcoin will be priced at $10k in 2013 or even earlier? On the contrary, some coins that are priced at $100 or $1000 turn to dust in the last bear market, so yeah it involves a lot of luck that you don't hold the wrong coins. If you want to avoid something like this, you can probably try to save some coins/tokens instead of selling all of them. I don't think there is no other option unless you're filthy rich and you can spend $1000 to buy every single coin/token that exists in the market right now.

comments.author: alegotardo
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMHi guys I created this task because I was wondering that wether someone got some more than 10k or even 50k dogecoin in 2018 or even 2017 where dogecoin price was very low and at that time I was getting free money from https://freedogeco.in (Note: This website has been shut down) And I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future.Yes!I created my account here at bitcointalk in 2017 with the initial intention of disclosing a btcspiner.io referal link (which was promptly warned and deleted), after which I got to know some interesting topics and learned how to use the forum correctly.Anyway, what I want to say is that at that time I was addicted to these faucet sites, and just like freebitco.in, freedogeco.in was also one of my favorites.In this bitcoin I was later able to withdraw a small fortune in satoshis.However, at freedogeco.in I had a great disappointment, because after a long time without logging in I had lost my password and also access to the e-mail I used to register... I lost several dogecoins, regretting this fact right at the time when they valued more and more.Since then, I hate this coin.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I recall getting some dogecoins as well, it was not from that exact source though. It was rather a unsatisfactory experience because something similar happened to me, I had about a handful of USD in Doge and I decided to sell days before the huge price increase it made until reaching its ATH. I would have easily gotten a good profit and bought a new phone or something. Since then, I avoid all kind of dog coins and tokens as the plague. Still salty from that experience.

comments.author: bettercrypto
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMHi guys I created this task because I was wondering that wether someone got some more than 10k or even 50k dogecoin in 2018 or even 2017 where dogecoin price was very low and at that time I was getting free money from https://freedogeco.in (Note: This website has been shut down) And I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future. I think it looks like you are not the only one who has experienced that, because I was also one of those who used it in 2017, I even got into a platform with a type of doge faucets that was able to cash out at that time when I had already saved up I got 10k doge, at that time the price value of doge was around 28 satoshi.     There is nothing we can do but move on, face and prepare for the future, after all, it is not too late for us. This is just a lesson from our past, friend.

comments.author: len01
comments.body: you remind me of my past sorrows. I used to earn almost 40k doge on Freedogeco.in and at that time I immediately sold it at a very cheap price because I thought dogecoin didn't have a good future.but in 2021 i heard that the dogecoin pump was very high, so i tried to calculate the estimate i should get, i was very disappointed.but even though I was disappointed that I sold doge too soon, it was a valuable lesson for me not to rush into selling popular coins that have been around for a long time.Freedogeco.in is one of the best faucet sites for me in the past. but unfortunately the site can no longer be opened.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMHi guys I created this task because I was wondering that wether someone got some more than 10k or even 50k dogecoin in 2018 or even 2017 where dogecoin price was very low and at that time I was getting free money from https://freedogeco.in (Note: This website has been shut down) And I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future. Since you got 30.000 Doge from a faucet I am sure you will like Faucetpay as they list a big list of the most trusted faucets and if you are patient enough you can still make a good amount of Doge,of course you cannot make anymore 30.000 Doge from such faucets as they have decremented drastically the payout because of Doge increase in price.I had also 2800 Doge but that at least I got about 1200 dollars from them as I had them lying in a multidoge wallet which luckily left me to import the key in a dogechain wallet.Nothing you can do,life goes on and I hope you find your next opportunity.

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: I wonder who's the owner behind of freedogeco.in site because I don't find it, my assumptions it's owned by freebitco.in owner, but after I search they're own freedoge.co.in, not freedogeco.in, both of the sites have been shutdown too.Quote from: wetsuit on June 04, 2014, 06:40:32 AMHello allI am the operator of FreeBitco.in and I have made http://FreeDoge.co.in which is a Dogecoin faucet with a gambling component, where you can win upto $200 in free dogecoins every hour and then play a HI-LO game with your won DOGE to win upto 100x.Well I forget how much I earn from faucet, but I think it's less than you @OP. It was a good old days where we can easily make money due to other people's ignorance, but we can still make money now although it's need a capital.

comments.author: Renampun
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMHi guys I created this task because I was wondering that wether someone got some more than 10k or even 50k dogecoin in 2018 or even 2017 where dogecoin price was very low and at that time I was getting free money from https://freedogeco.in (Note: This website has been shut down) And I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future. besides often using freebitco to just get a little satoshi from the faucet, I also often use freedoge and at that time around 2017 I managed to get 15 thousand dogecoin from there, I immediately sold it because I didn't think that the price of dogecoin would soar in future (a few years later, elon musk did shilling on that and the price of dogecoin soared)right now there are no good faucet sites to just get a few coins, some gambling sites may still provide faucets but the value is not much anymore.

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMAnd I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future. This is crypto, when something is gone, it's gone. I know a person in real life who had somewhere like 90k doge long ago. He never saved the wallet key or he thought he saved it somewhere, did not care about it at all. But last year or before that when the price of doge went super high then we was looking for the wallet file/key everything. He did not find any clue. In the mean time he also changed his laptop several times LOLI always suggest everyone to keep wallet files/seed phase in a place where you can find it easily even after few decades. You never know something you have worth nothing today, someday it can make you a lot of money. But I don't suggest people to be in shitcoin.

comments.author: michellee
comments.body: I remember that site I used to get a lot of free Dogecoin. I forgot the exact amount but as far as I can remember, it was more than 20k-30k, especially since I was also looking for Dogecoin faucets from other sites. At that time, it was really fun to get lots of free coins besides Dogecoins and in one hour, the rewards I could get were very much.It's only natural that you regret it because we don't know what will happen. But you shouldn't think it's too late to hold potential coins because the market hasn't experienced a full reversal yet, so you can still buy potential coins that are expected to go up in the future.

comments.author: Zwei
comments.body: Man, this brings some memories, good and bad ones.I remember the first ever crypto coins I got were from faucets, nothing crazy like 30k DOGE, it was in the 5k to 10k DOGE range, beside Freebitco.in and Freedoge.co.in, I used to claim coins on Moon Dogecoin, and Moon bitcoin, does anyone remember those? And faucetbox too? I think I did it for a few weeks and realized that it's a waste of time and stoped. The funny thing is after exchanging everything to bitcoin(~0.05 BTC) I got scammed trying to exchange it for PayPal in a local Facebook group.

comments.author: xSkylarx
comments.body: Good old back memories. I visited the majority of the faucet sites. I just can't clearly remember how much I earn on this, but I always visit this website after school to make claims, and there are a couple of faucets that I am visiting. Though I don't regret selling it before because I really needed money, so no matter what the price is, I won't regret it because I benefited from it before, even though the price is low. Also, we should move on right now and try to invest in promising coins.

comments.author: kamvreto
comments.body: Everyone will regret it as you do. I don't know how many millions of Doge I collected in the past when Doge prices were still very cheap. All the faucets were giving away large amounts of Doge. freedogeco.in was also a place where I got up to even 50k DOGE, but yes just like you did too, selling it for 40 dollars or even less. It all seemed worthless in the past, but when you look at the incredible DOGE prices today, it's just wishful thinking. Regret or not I don't think there is anything to regret.

comments.author: CryptoHeadlineNews
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMHi guys I created this task because I was wondering that wether someone got some more than 10k or even 50k dogecoin in 2018 or even 2017 where dogecoin price was very low and at that time I was getting free money from https://freedogeco.in (Note: This website has been shut down) And I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future. I once took part in mining this free Dogecoin and Shiba inu when they got launched on several faucet websites, but I later stopped because It wasn't worth my time back, as for you to reach minimum withdrawal one needed to be active for at least 3 to 4 months of active participation. However, lucky are the people who kept on mining and never gave up in the process, because today these coins now have significant value, of which only if you didn't sell your 30k Dogecoin for 35 or 40 dollars, by today that 30k Doge would have amounted to $2252 by the current price of dogecoin to be $0.0754. And the price still has more tendency to rise with the increase in the adoption of Dogecoin.

comments.author: piebeyb
comments.body: I once attracted some doge there and I moved them to the cryptopia exchange then cryptopia got hacked so I lost my dogecoin, but not many dogecoin there were lost and besides it was a free coin so I wasn't too disappointed because my income was from freedogecoin, since freedogecoin closed I switched and was more active to freebitcoin which until now still survives.

comments.author: Wakate
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMHi guys I created this task because I was wondering that wether someone got some more than 10k or even 50k dogecoin in 2018 or even 2017 where dogecoin price was very low and at that time I was getting free money from https://freedogeco.in (Note: This website has been shut down) And I have gotten almost more than 30k Dogecoin and I hag regret that I sold than on a mere 35 or 40 dollars and after 1 or 2 year I was stunned to see Dogecoin price and I still regret this. I have no idea what have I done. Maybe I should have kept it and maybe that was fate to regret only past. Now I have moved On. So I am hoping for a good future.  I so much like your confidence to explain how you were able to accumulate a lot of dogcoin for a certain period of time and selling them then due to market pressure or fear that the market would fall and you are going to make loses on coin that you never paid a dime to get. That is how the market works and we should be very careful how to do things or we might end up selling the coin that may give us a huge amount of money if only we can hold for a little while. This is why it's very important for us to hold and keep holding not minding the market pressure and what many influencers do write about projects trying to describe when we should sell and when we should buy. We need to keep holding as long as we want to make a bigger profits.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: OP, this thread of yours reminds me of one I read and that thread was made in 2014, about the gambling site FreeBitco.in giving away $200 doge/hour to users who bet there.Thread I mean.Quote from: wetsuit on June 04, 2014, 06:40:32 AMHello allI am the operator of FreeBitco.in and I have made http://FreeDoge.co.in which is a Dogecoin faucet with a gambling component, where you can win upto $200 in free dogecoins every hour and then play a HI-LO game with your won DOGE to win upto 100x.The minimum payout is only 5 DOGE and you can request it any time and the coins will be sent to your wallet within 24 hours.I would appreciate any suggestions or feedback that you may have.Therefore Doge at that time was really very low in price, but I don't know exactly if they really got it, because I never used the FreeBitco.in gambling site until now, maybe yes they got doge at that time.Bottom line: lucky if they kept it at the highs back in 2021.

comments.author: Slow death
comments.body: Quote from: Maxre on March 28, 2023, 06:19:41 PMAnd I have gotten almost more than 30k DogecoinThis brings me memories of the past, I spent the whole day claiming dogecoin on this site, then I converted it to bitcoin, I remember that in the days there were 100 to 500 doge every 1 hour if my memory serves me correctly, so I managed to claim a lot of doge coins , there were really many, because at that time in 2017, in the beginning, the price of bitcoin was very low, which forced me to have to claim many dogecoins so that when I exchanged for bitcoin and later exchanged bitcoin for dollars, a value would come out that would allow me to make withdrawals, I was I've been using this site for a long time, without a doubt it was the best doge coin faucet I had at the time because the interface was very easy and they paid wellUnfortunately, nowadays we no longer have faucets like in the past, time has passed and everything has gone bad for anyone who enters this cryptocurrency market, you have to have money to buy, you have to have documents for KYC, the good times of the past no longer exist. currently only money matters, cryptocurrencies have become just a means of increasing money, nobody enters this market for love anymore, nobody gets an altcoin for love, and it's all about money
